item.title: 法国收益率逼近意大利，安全市场形象荡然无存
item.description: 先是爱尔兰，然后是葡萄牙和西班牙，现在又是希腊。随着法国作为安全稳定的债券市场地位的瓦解，十多年前欧洲债务危机的核心国家一个接一个地超越了法国。【原文：First Ireland, then Portugal and Spain, and now Greece. One after another, countries at the heart of Europe’s debt crisis more than a decade ago are outshining France, as its standing as a safe-and-stable bond market disintegrates.】

item.title: 与维克多-什韦茨一起深入探讨即将到来的 20 年风暴
item.description:
这又是三四十年代吗？【原文：

Is this the ‘30s and ‘40s again?

】

item.title: 诺基亚首席执行官谈为何要将 5G 装入士兵背包
item.description:
佩卡-伦德马克（Pekka Lundmark）认为芬兰通信公司有机会在国防和数据中心领域实现增长。【原文：

Pekka Lundmark sees opportunities for the Finnish communications company to grow in defense and data centers.

】

item.title: 与维克多-什韦茨探讨即将到来的 20 年风暴的更多内容
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的当选，以及他承诺征收更多关税和对移民采取更严格立场的承诺，是重大宏观不确定性的来源。在一些人看来，这标志着新自由主义关于全球化的共识以及金融市场所扮演的重要角色的终结。今天的嘉宾认为，我们正处于一个漫长而动荡的时期的开端，这个时期可能在未来二十年内都无法解决。在本期节目中，我们将与宏观战略家维克多-什韦茨（Viktor Shvets）以及新书《全球化的未来》（Th.【原文：The election of Donald Trump, with his promise of more tariffs and a much tighter stance on immigration is a source of major macro uncertainty. To some it marks the end of a certain neoliberal consensus about globalization, and the pre-eminent role played by financial markets. According to today’s guest, we’re at the beginning of a long, turbulent period that may not be resolved for two decades to come. On this episode, we speak with macro strategist Viktor Shvets, and author of the new book, Th】

item.title: 欧洲央行称 10 月份消费者通胀预期有所上升
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank —）的数据显示，欧元区消费者的通胀预期在10月份有所上升；这为决策者支持谨慎降息的观点提供了支持。【原文：Inflation expectations of consumers in the euro area edged higher in October, according to the European Central Bank — supporting policymakers arguing in favor of a cautious approach to lowering interest rates.】

item.title: 美团收入超出预期，中国经济复苏迹象明显
item.description: 美团网的季度营收增长了22%，好于预期，这表明随着中国政府试图重振经济，在线商务和旅游正在逐步复苏。【原文：Meituan’s quarterly revenue climbed a better-than-expected 22%, signaling a gradual recovery in online commerce and travel as Beijing tries to jumpstart the economy.】

item.title: 印度央行询问流动性问题引发对下周行动的猜测
item.description: 据知情人士透露，印度央行本周已就银行系统的现金状况加强了与国库交易员的对话，这引发了人们对印度央行可能会在12月6日的政策审查中宣布一些提高流动性的措施的猜测。【原文：India’s central bank has stepped up dialogue with traders at treasury desks this week about cash conditions in the banking system, according to people with knowledge of the matter, spurring speculation it may announce some measures to boost liquidity at the policy review on Dec. 6.】

item.title: 尽管特朗普发出关税威胁，台湾仍上调 2025 年 GDP 预测
item.description: 尽管当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的回归有可能扰乱贸易，台湾仍上调了明年的经济增长预期。【原文：Taiwan raised its forecast for economic growth next year even though the return of President-elect Donald Trump threatens to disrupt trade.】

item.title: 关税风险和法国政局拖累欧洲股市暂停上涨
item.description: 周五，欧洲股市持稳，投资者在对贸易关税的担忧和法国最近的政治动荡中寻找新的催化剂。【原文：European stocks were steady on Friday as investors looked for fresh catalysts amid worries over trade tariffs and recent political turmoil in France, with the government struggling to approve the budget.】

item.title: 日本央行研究称，日本刺激政策避免了多年通货紧缩
item.description: 根据日本央行发布的研究报告，如果没有日本央行的大规模货币刺激计划，日本可能会在 2016 年左右开始的几年里面临通货紧缩。【原文：Japan could have faced deflation for several years starting around 2016 without the Bank of Japan’s massive monetary stimulus program, according to research published by the central bank.】

item.title: 日本超长收益率超过中国，两极分化加剧
item.description: 由于亚洲两个最大经济体的前景出现分歧，日本较长期限债券收益率在 11 月底将高于中国同类债券收益率。【原文：Japan’s longer-maturity bond yields are set to end November higher than their Chinese equivalents as the outlook for Asia’s two biggest economies diverges.】

item.title: 很少有人预料到的美国股市黄金年
item.description: 一年前，股票投资者和策略师还在为 2024 年可能出现的动荡做准备，担心美国经济硬着陆的风险，以及降息可能来得太晚而无法避免。【原文：A year ago, equity investors and strategists braced for a potential turbulent 2024, worrying about the risk of a hard landing for the US economy and interest rates cuts that could come too late to prevent it.】

item.title: 日本今年为芯片和人工智能额外拨款 99 亿美元
item.description: 日本将再拨款 1.5 万亿日元（99 亿美元），用于推动其芯片和人工智能事业，其中包括月球代工项目 Rapidus 公司。【原文：Japan is allocating another ¥1.5 trillion ($9.9 billion) to boost its chip and artificial intelligence endeavors including moonshot foundry project Rapidus Corp.】

item.title: 供应链问题迫使印度航空重新调整增长计划
item.description: 印度航空公司（Air India Ltd. ）首席执行官坎贝尔-威尔逊（Campbell Wilson）表示，由于新飞机交付的延迟和供应链的障碍阻碍了这家塔塔集团旗下航空公司的转型努力，印度航空公司不得不 "重新调整 "其雄心勃勃的增长计划。【原文：Air India Ltd. has had to “recalibrate” its ambitious growth plans as delays in deliveries of new planes and supply chain snags hamper the efforts to transform the Tata Group-owned carrier, according to Chief Executive Officer Campbell Wilson.】

item.title: FountainVest 和 Unison 斥资 6.6 亿美元收购珠宝商 Tasaki
item.description: 据知情人士透露，FountainVest Partners Co.和 Unison Capital 已以约 1,000 亿日元（约合 6.6 亿美元）的价格收购了日本珠宝商 Tasaki & Co.。【原文：FountainVest Partners Co. and Unison Capital have acquired Japanese jeweler Tasaki & Co. for about ¥100 billion ($660 million), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 法国经济疲软，通胀加速低于预期
item.description: 随着信心的减弱，法国通胀率的增长速度低于预期，仍远低于欧洲中央银行 2% 的目标，支持了进一步降低利率的理由。【原文：French inflation quickened less than expected as confidence wanes, remaining well below the European Central Bank’s 2% target and supporting the case for interest rates to be lowered further.】

item.title: 瑞典第三季度经济增长扭转了此前数据显示的下滑趋势
item.description: 瑞典第三季度的产出出人意料地增长，这对央行来说可能是一个值得欢迎的迹象，因为该央行今年已四次降息，以启动萎靡不振的经济。【原文：Sweden’s output unexpectedly expanded during the third quarter in what could prove a welcome sign to a central bank that’s deployed four interest-rate cuts this year to kickstart the spluttering economy.】

item.title: ABC Technologies 将以 13 亿美元收购汽车供应商 TI Fluid
item.description: 加拿大汽车零部件制造商 ABC 技术控股公司同意以约 10 亿英镑（13 亿美元）的价格收购英国 TI 流体系统公司。【原文：ABC Technologies Holdings Inc., a Canadian auto parts maker, agreed to buy Britain’s TI Fluid Systems Plc for about £1 billion ($1.3 billion).】

item.title: 路透社报道：汇丰撤出中国信用卡业务
item.description: 路透社援引身份不明的消息来源报道称，汇丰控股有限公司正在撤出其在中国的信用卡业务。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc is pulling back from its credit card business in China, Reuters reported, citing unidentified sources.】

item.title: 乌干达证实中央银行遭黑客攻击，驳斥 1,700 万美元指控
item.description: 乌干达财政部证实了媒体关于黑客入侵中央银行系统并盗取资金的报道，但驳斥了关于黑客盗取了多达 1700 万美元资金的说法。【原文：Uganda’s finance ministry confirmed media reports that hackers breached the central bank’s systems and stole money, but refuted claims that they spirited away as much as $17 Million.】

item.title: 投资者拒绝创始人之子进入董事会，Zee 股票上涨
item.description: 媒体集团 Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd. 的股票在股东否决了重新任命公司创始人之子兼首席执行官 Punit Goenka 为董事会董事的提议后大涨。【原文：Media conglomerate Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd.’s stock surged after shareholders rejected the proposal to re-appoint Punit Goenka, founder’s son and Chief Executive Officer, as a board director.】

item.title: 土耳其经济在高利率环境下增长有限
item.description: 土耳其经济在第三季度增长了 2.1%，但增长受到了高借贷成本的制约。【原文：Turkey’s economy expanded by 2.1% in the third quarter, with growth constrained by high borrowing costs.】

item.title: 约翰内斯堡因供水不足而考虑加强用水限制
item.description: 南非的商业之都正在考虑采取更严格的限水措施，因为它既要维护老化的基础设施，又要应对日益增长的需求。【原文：South Africa’s business capital is considering tighter water curbs as it battles to maintain aging infrastructure and cope with increased demand.】

item.title: 欧尔班任命忠诚的财政部长掌管匈牙利中央银行
item.description: 匈牙利总理维克托-欧尔班（Viktor Orban）提名其长期担任财政部长的米哈里-瓦尔加（Mihaly Varga）掌管匈牙利央行，投资者对欧洲最紧缩货币政策之一的潜在影响保持警惕。【原文：Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban nominated his longtime finance minister Mihaly Varga to helm the central bank, with investors on alert for potential implications for one of the tightest monetary policies in Europe.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英镑上涨，重回 1.27 美元上方
芬兰第三季度经济增长显示经济复苏在望
item.description: 芬兰第三季度的经济增长与早先的预测基本一致，这证实了这个北欧国家正走在复苏的道路上，预计明年将加快步伐。【原文：Finland’s economy grew largely in line with earlier projections in the third quarter, confirming the Nordic nation is on a path to recovery that’s expected to pick up pace next year.】

item.title: 南非股市反弹取决于盈利预期是否超预期
item.description: 南非股市需要超越不断上升的盈利预期，才能将创纪录的涨势延续到 2025 年。但并非所有投资者都相信他们能做到。【原文：South African stocks need to beat rising earnings expectations to prolong their record-setting rally into 2025. Not all investors are convinced they can.】

item.title: 据说 Orkla 考虑 4 亿美元上市印度业务
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，挪威奥克拉公司（Orkla ASA）正在考虑明年对其印度业务进行首次公开募股，募集资金可能高达4亿美元。【原文：Norway’s Orkla ASA is considering an initial public offering of its Indian business next year that could raise as much as $400 million, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 德里空气污染严重，印度仍削减汽车廉价汽油供应
item.description: 印度正在削减廉价车用天然气的供应，因为印度正努力应对国内生产短缺的问题，此举可能会加剧包括新德里在内的大城市的有毒空气问题。【原文：India is cutting back its supply of cheap gas for vehicles as it struggles to cope with domestic production shortages, a move that could add to toxic air woes in major cities including New Delhi.】

item.title: 特朗普胜选刺激消费，印度 IT 股表现突出
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普的回归引发了美元走强和技术外包增加的预期，印度大型 IT 服务提供商的股票在近期反弹后有望进一步上扬，与其他行业的疲软情绪背道而驰。【原文：Large Indian IT service providers’ stocks are poised for a further run-up after a recent rally, bucking the weak sentiment in other sectors as Donald Trump’s return generates expectations of a stronger dollar and greater tech outsourcing.】
